job.title: Postgres Development DBA - Remote
job.description: About UsSince 2007, Webgility has helped over 10,000 companies with ecommerce automation. Today, we are the #1 automation software for QuickBooks & NetSuite retailers. Business is booming, and we’re growing at warp speed!Our MissionEmpower small & medium-sized enterprises to thrive in ecommerce. We integrate their systems, automate their operations & deliver powerful insights so they can move faster, make better decisions and win!Our Core ValuesKeep it real. We do amazing work but we're humble, transparent, and accountable. If we make mistakes, we own up and always keep it real. No egos, please.Stay curious. No matter what we're working on, we give it our 100%. We're always learning and feel connected to our team and our customers.Lead with data. We focus on results, not activity. We understand—both for ourselves and our customers—that data and software are key. We use them both so our work creates real impact.Win as a team.  We come for the job and stay for the people. We love good food and drink. There are always laughs to be had, whether a budget meeting or a bowling party.Enjoy the journey. Our customers often tell us that our software has changed their lives. We want to change the face of the ecommerce industry by helping businesses easily run back-office operations.As a development DBA for Webgility, you will:Design stable, reliable and effective databasesCollaborate with a team of world-class developers on their design decisions, giving advice on performance and writing good SQLPrepare deployment scripts and produce deployment plansPrepare rollback scripts and produce rollback plansProvide administration of development, testing and staging serversOffer consulting on optimal architecture and data modelsDetermine, enforce and document database policies, procedures and standardsPerform business requirement analysis with PMCreate and manage schema documentation and other technical artifacts relating to developmentWork cross-team with other co-located teams, remote teams, and external partner companiesRequired Job Skills and Experience4+ years work experience as a Database developer building commercial softwareBS Degree in Computer Science, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent job experienceExtensive experience with PostgreSQLIn-depth understanding of data management (e.g. permissions, recovery, security and monitoring)Extensive experience working with agile sprint teams to collaborateExcellent analytical and organization skillsAn ability to understand front-end users requirements and a problem-solving attitudeExcellent verbal and written communication skillsResearch and suggest new database products, services and protocolsOther RequirementsMust be a US citizen or authorized to work in the US. Visa sponsorship currently not available.Deep ThoughtsBe a part of something bigger with more opportunity and ownership of innovative ecommerce solutions. Ecommerce continues to grow at record speeds and you can help disrupt the market. Did you know? In the time it took you to read this, there were 200,000 searches on eBay and over 45,000 autonomous robots now roam Amazon warehouses in search of their next package.
